string.text: Log:\nNo extra payment has been received for the last contract. Deal with the client.

Log:
Western stash. Yantar
Restock:
assault rifle ammo
medkits
repair kits
Took the last of it.

Log:
Intercept (from maxek@iborn.com):
Caravan — 4 carriers (liquidate). Blue case on a chain. Do not open.
Extraction point: Swamps, Burned Farmstead. Three days.
$5000 (advance $1500)
Log:\nSergachov!!!\nDo not take contracts. No contact. Possible setup (working for special services? Verify).
Log:\nBar. Sultan. Special weapons.\nTry placing an order through a proxy (Frantic? Rychagirsky?).
Incoming:\nGreetings.
Outgoing:\nGood afternoon.
Incoming:\nSo what’s the situation? Report.
Outgoing:\nNothing worked out.
Incoming:\nHow is that possible?!
Outgoing:\nThat’s how. You think it’s all that simple? Interested parties interfered, everything stalled...
Incoming:\nWhat nonsense are you talking?! Who could possibly be more interested than us?
Outgoing:\nI can’t name them right now. In person...
Incoming:\nAre you out of your mind?! Who are these people who can shut everything down like that?!

Outgoing:\nDon’t push me. I’m telling you — there’s interference. I can’t overcome it. Neither can you. Force majeure. And these are very serious people — not your weight class. If we push, we’ll both end up feathered.
Incoming:\nIf this collapses today, feathers will fly from me for sure. And you won’t be spared either!
Outgoing:\nI doubt it. Tell your boss the truth — let him deal with them. He should know who they are.
Incoming:\nYou don’t doubt anything when it comes to taking money. That’s it — you’ve pissed me off. It’ll be a miracle if you live past the day after tomorrow.
Outgoing:\nMiracles do happen sometimes... I don’t have time to argue with you. Excuse me — I don’t know you.
Incoming:\nWell, well... So that’s your tune now? Find yourself a sturdier bunker, you scum.
Outgoing:\nRude. Someone will contact you today and tell you where to bring the money for that kind of attitude. End of transmission.
Incoming:\nGood afternoon!
Outgoing:\nHello. I’m listening.
Incoming:\nStarting tomorrow, we begin a large-scale artifact buyout operation.
Outgoing:\nOur task?
Incoming:\nFirst, eliminate the possibility of selling to the Bootlegger, so all artifacts go exclusively through us.
Outgoing:\nStart a shootout?
Incoming:\nYes. But don’t overdo it. Your task is to observe and intervene only in critical situations. Fighting will be done by Cherepanov and his psychos.
Outgoing:\nDuration of the operation?
Incoming:\nTwo to three weeks. We expect to crash the market in that time and buy artifacts from stalkers at prices that suit us.
Outgoing:\nAren’t you worried new buyers will replace the neutralized ones?
Incoming:\nNot your concern. Do your job. Neither side should win. Especially Cherepanov. But the Warehouses must be dangerous — very dangerous.
Outgoing:\nAnd if Cherepanov gains the upper hand?
Incoming:\nUnder no circumstances! We need Freedom here to maintain regional stability. If necessary — eliminate Cherepanov’s men.
Outgoing:\nUnderstood.
Incoming:\nLone stalkers will start moving through your checkpoint en masse. Do not interfere. Spread rumors that the road to our bunker is scouted and safe.
Outgoing:\nIs it actually safe?
Incoming:\nYes. Marked with stakes. But let only loners through.
Outgoing:\nWhat about everyone else?
Incoming:\nMost likely Borov’s people or envoys from the Barkeep will approach you, asking to pass their artifact courier to us. Refuse.
Outgoing:\nLiquidation?
Incoming:\nNo. Offer to buy the artifacts yourselves. Set a reasonable price — you won’t lose out.
Outgoing:\nWho starts first — us or Cherepanov’s people? And how do we coordinate?
Incoming:\nNo coordination. We’re playing Cherepanov blind. Disinformation has been planted that Lukash is planning an attack on the farmstead. Expect the mess to start tomorrow around noon.
Outgoing:\nCopy that. Preparing for the operation.
Incoming:\nGood luck! Use this channel only in extreme cases.
Incoming:\nHello.
Outgoing:\nWho are you?
Incoming:\nI’m from Black. “Clouds fly over the rose...”
Outgoing:\nGot it. Get to the point.
Incoming:\nStill taking contracts?
Outgoing:\nNot officially. Command doesn’t like distractions.
Incoming:\nPity...
Outgoing:\nWait. Let’s talk. Contracts vary. No need for the top to know everything.
Incoming:\nUnderstood... 50. Everything’s in place.
Outgoing:\n100.
Incoming:\n70.
Outgoing:\nDeal. Instructions?
Incoming:\nSame location. Nothing unusual, just don’t go alone — take at least three more people. A sniper is preferable.
Outgoing:\nThat’s “nothing unusual”? No. Let’s settle this properly.
Incoming:\nFor you it’s nothing unusual... Fine. I agree to 100.
Outgoing:\nNow I don’t agree. We have rules — no clashes with the army.
Incoming:\nCome on, this isn’t a marketplace. Final price. And it’s not the army. I assure you — nothing serious. Extra people are just a precaution.
Outgoing:\nFine. 100 and weapons — same drop point. And clear instructions. If something’s off... we’ll talk later.
Incoming:\nEverything will be as agreed. Instructions will follow. Deadline — 48 hours from now. Goodbye.
Incoming:\nLovely weather, wouldn’t you say?
Outgoing:\nSomething happened? Any news?
Incoming:\nTwo pieces. Which one first? As usual?
Outgoing:\nEnough already. Get to the point.

Incoming:\nAlright. I’ll give you the collected intel with a preliminary analysis. Long ago — about a year and a half or two — a group with the poetic name “Clear Sky” appeared in the Swamps, led by a certain Mr. Lebedev...

Incoming:\nThis group handled practical research tasks related to studying the Zone. On the surface, simple information gathering. What exactly they collected, however, remains unclear. Scientists or not — hard to say. And then someone appears among them...
Outgoing:\nNow it’s getting interesting...
Incoming:\nThis someone suddenly starts actively working with these scientists. Apparently, he was very interested in strengthening the clan’s position.
Outgoing:\nAnd?

Incoming:\nThat someone develops a strong desire to reach the center of the Zone. From that moment, Lebedev turns against him and the group he assembled, despite all the prior assistance this someone had given Clear Sky...
Outgoing:\nI still don’t see where this is going...

Incoming:\nHere’s the point. Lebedev gives off very bad vibes. I was discreetly told FROM ABOVE that the name is familiar to them. Very familiar. Especially since his associates — Kalanch and Suslov — are also known and officially listed as dead. Do you follow?
Outgoing:\nNot quite. Officially dead how?

Incoming:\nConfirmed deaths. Recorded. Families mourned. They’re gone — yet they exist. But the key figure is Lebedev: messages are still being intercepted from him. To whom? From where? How did he reappear after his first death, and where did he vanish after the supposed second?
Incoming:\nAnd the sweetest part: the messages show he’s talking about the object we’re interested in — and speaking as if he HAS it.
Outgoing:\nCan those messages be trusted?
Incoming:\nDoesn’t matter anymore. What matters is a real lead. Right now, priority one is finding this guy and taking a look at him. Very interesting.
Outgoing:\nThen we need more data on these “blues” — I mean Clear Sky. Who that someone was, why Lebedev turned on him... and where to find them. Both of them.
Incoming:\nWorking on it. Await instructions.
